topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53ced8bd63687214b1c10000#post_53ced8bd63687214b1c10000
Daily, but I don't use primer, powder or anything like that. If I even use concealer, it's just on certain spots. I spend a lot of time on skincare, so it's quite fair. I use a thin line of eyeliner for my eyes and some eyeshadow if I feel like it. Most days I leave my lips either bare or put on a little gloss. I always put on some eyebrow gel.
For special occasions I go all out, mostly because these occasions usually take place in the evening, when makeup is harder to see in the first place.

Edit: and mascara, of course. When I put on mascara, I curl my lashes too, but that effect never lasts very long. I have used false lashes here and there, mostly for weddings and whatnot.

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53cedaba6368721886140000#post_53cedaba6368721886140000
There's good makeup and really, REALLY bad makeup. Yes, good makeup and some primer helps. Hairspray too, but I wouldn't recommend spraying too much of that in your face. I only recommend that when you're about to do a dance performance under those hot spot lights or something.
My biggest personal problem is that there really isn't a good cruelty-free mascara yet. Not one that I can afford anyway.
